channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Problematic Yellow Box, 4th February
item.description:
Yellow box at this junction of Westwood Hill and Lawrie Park Road in Sydenham. Yellow box is too large, it should only be on the south side and should not be this close to a pedestrian crossing which means large vehicles receive a PCN if they stop for a pedestrian!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Hill, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large area of pavement is raised, behind street light, 4th February
item.description:
Large area of pavement raised, most likely caused by tree roots as to the inner side of the pavement (near grass). Area under street light but at night time shadow caused by tree and can make it difficult to notice. Has been present for some time now, in November caused trip and fall and damaged my leg and possessions. Remains a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dropped kerb, 4th February
item.description:
The kerb (outside of the property on the pavement side) has dropped badly and continues to sink. This has happened gradually over the last few years. There is a risk of damage to the underside of cars when reversing out the driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Covet Wood Close, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly damaged car end of Glenlea Road, 4th February
item.description:
Not sure how long it has been there but there is a badly damaged car at the junction of Glenlea and Glenesk Road. There is no license plate and no obvious sign of an accident. Is it possible to arrange for this to be removed?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenlea Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
